reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Acceleration of Malaria Elimination in Indonesia

description.narrative: Indonesia - Malaria - Persatuan Karya Dharma Kesehatan Indonesia (also known as “PERDHAKI”, Association of Voluntary Health Services of Indonesia) - PERDHAKI. This program has the following goals: 75% of the Indonesian territory is free of malaria transmission and no district is high-endemic by end 2024.. The objectives of this program are: The decrease in number of districts with API > 1 ‰ from 61 in 2018 (the baseline) to 17 districts by 2023 (end NSP Period page 29). The increase in number of malaria-free districts from 285 in 2018 to 385 districts by end 2023 (end NSP Period page 29). Malaria-free status is maintained in Districts which have been awarded with malaria- free certification. (NSP page 29)

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for IDN-M-PERDHAK
Percentage of health facilities with essential medicines and life-saving commodities in stock
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at private sector sites
Percentage of service delivery reports from community health workers integrated into HMIS
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at private sector sites
Impact indicator for IDN-M-PERDHAK
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Malaria I-Other1: Number of malaria deaths
Malaria I-4: Malaria test positivity rate in Eastern Part of Indonesia (disaggregated by species vivax, falciparum, others)
Malaria I-4: Malaria test positivity rate in Sumatera, NTB, Kalimantan, Sulawesi, Java, and Bali (disaggregated by species vivax, falciparum, others)
Outcome indicator for IDN-M-PERDHAK
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
